name: ARACHNE Lace, "Lex, Dream, and Galadriel" 2 skeins available Merino + Silk, 1300 yards
description: Lex Luthor, Dream's Cloak, and Galadriel's Flask walk into a bar.... So in my late-night addled state of naming yarns, I failed to observe that these yarns were all from the same batch, but slightly different. So they have alllll different names, cos that's not confusing at all. Photo 1: Galadriel's Flask Photo 2: 1980s Lex What to do with so much lace. I know. Life is SO hard. I recommend making an entire sweater, like Lacy Ribbons by Romi Hill. Or you know, never worry about having enough yarn to do all the extra repeats you wanna do on that lace shawl. ;) For skeins that're NOT identical, I recommend alternating skeins every couple of rows. I know it sounds like a pain, but it's actually not because you can carry the skeins up the back/inside of the work and you get a charmingly variegated look. S º P º E º C º S 80% Superfine Merino, 20% Silk 2 ply 1300+ yards, 3.5oz lace C º O º L º O º R º S Sky Turquoise Mint Grass Hunter Deep Purple Slate Grey Gray Tweet To see the info on all the bases side by side, check out my handy-dandy comparison guide. Shipping Details. Washing instructions & Disclaimers.

name: ARACHNE Lace, "Jubilee" Merino + Silk, 1300 yards
description: On the one hand, I'm glad Fox didn't denigrate Jubilee by featuring her prominently in those painfully awful XMen movies (but yes, I did catch the cameo). On the other hand, Jubilee is adorable. What to do with so much lace. I know. Life is SO hard. I recommend making an entire sweater, like Lacy Ribbons by Romi Hill. Or you know, never worry about having enough yarn to do all the extra repeats you wanna do on that lace shawl. ;) These skeins very greatly in color. One skein is mostly violent pink, one skein is more golden than the others, and one is right in between. if you have any preferences, drop me a line at the time of purchase. For skeins that're NOT identical, I recommend alternating skeins every couple of rows. I know it sounds like a pain, but it's actually not because you can carry the skeins up the back/inside of the work and you get a charmingly variegated look. S º P º E º C º S 80% Superfine Merino, 20% Silk 2 ply 1300+ yards, 3.5oz lace C º O º L º O º R º S Magenta No really, Muh-GENT-uh. Golden Sunshine Golden Ochre Golden Pumpkin Pale Sunset Orange Tweet To see the info on all the bases side by side, check out my handy-dandy comparison guide. Shipping Details. Washing instructions & Disclaimers.

name: Queen Bee Spinning Wheel, by SpinOlution
description: Such a delicious wheel! Airline approved, fits in any car, opens & closes ready to spin or travel in under 30 seconds. Yeah, pretty cool, right? If you're in the Boston area, I'd be glad to let you try out my Queen Bee. The Queen Bee has many improvements over current Spinning wheels available on the market. Some of the standard upgrades include: + Open Orifice – allows thread of any size to be spun. + Easy bobbin removal – no more hassles to change bobbins. + 7 Ratio Speed Spindle – work at your speed. + Multiple Bearings – for smooth and efficient operation. + Heel rests – keeps the wheel in front of you, not across the room. + Multiple rubber feet – for ultimate stability. + Heavy duty construction – for years of dependable use. + American made – what else can we say. S º P º E º C º S + Weight: 13 lbs. + Open Height: 30 inches; Width: 19 inches; Depth: 13 inches + Folded Height: 12 inches; Width: 19 inches; Depth: 9 inches + Wheel Size: 2-9 inch diameter 2 – 9 inch diameter + 1.5" thick + Number of Speeds:9 + Ratio: 1:5 to 1:36 (Approximately) 5, 7.5, 12, 12.5, 15, 18, 20, 27.5, 35 + 3 bobbins included (extra bobbins are $35 each) T º H º E º R º E º C º I º P º E Furniture grade Birch Plywood V º I º D º E º O º S & L º I º N º K º S Top 6 Reasons to Try a SpinOlution Opening/Closing the Bee Plying on the Bee S º H º I º P º P º Iº N º G http://www.knittink.bigcartel.com/shipping
